oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Practical Colostrum Evaluation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McGuirk, Sheila M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: high quality colostrum
calf rearing program
immunoglobulins
immune factor
protein
colostrum feeding program
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Provision of high quality colostrum is an essential feature of a successful calf rearing program, providing immunoglobulins, non-antibody immune factors, protein, energy, fat, vitamins and minerals. A successful colostrum feeding program reduces calf mortality to less than 5%, improves resistance to enteric disease and promotes weight gain the first four days of life. Careful evaluation of several important aspects of a colostrum feeding program is essential when these goals are to be achieved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1988; 79-82
